Rate Limit IDs Spark Core The specific RateLimitID(s) for this conduit's inflow and outflow will be specified in a future iteration of the Spark Artifact.
Rate Limits Spark Core The current maxAmount and slope for this conduit's inflow/outflow are defined in the subdocuments herein.
Inflow Rate Limits Spark Core The inflow rate limits are:
  • maxAmount: 25,000,000
  • slope: 5,000,000
Outflow Rate Limits Spark Core The outflow rate limits are:
  • maxAmount: Unlimited
  • slope: This parameter will be specified in a future iteration of the Spark Artifact.
Off-chain Operational Parameters Spark Core The documents herein contain specific off-chain parameters for this Instance.
Instance-specific Operational Processes Spark Core The documents herein contain operational procedures or monitoring requirements unique to this Instance that deviate from or otherwise supplement the general SLL processes.
Ethena Spark Core The Ethereum Mainnet Instances of the Ethena Protocol with Active Status are stored herein.
Ethereum Mainnet - Ethena USDe Instance Configuration Document Spark Core The documents herein contain the Instance Configuration Document for the Ethena USDe Instance.
RRC Framework Full Implementation Spark Core Pending
Parameters Spark Core The documents herein define the parameters of the Ethena USDe Instance of the Allocation System Primitive.
Instance Identifiers Spark Core The documents herein define the Instance identifiers
Network Spark Core Ethereum Mainnet
Target Protocol Spark Core Ethena Protocol
Asset Supplied By SLL Spark Core USDC
Token Spark Core USDe
Contract Addresses Spark Core The documents herein define the Instance contract addresses.
Token Address Spark Core 0x4c9edd5852cd905f086c759e8383e09bff1e68b3
Underlying Asset Address Spark Core This parameter will be specified in a future iteration of the Spark Artifact.
EthenaMinter Spark Core 0xe3490297a08d6fC8Da46Edb7B6142E4F461b62D3
Rate Limit IDs Spark Core The specific RateLimitID(s) for this conduit's inflow and outflow will be specified in a future iteration of the Spark Artifact.
Rate Limits Spark Core The current maxAmount and slope for this conduit's inflow/outflow are defined in the subdocuments herein.
Inflow Rate Limits Spark Core The inflow rate limits are:
  • maxAmount: 250,000,000
  • slope: 100,000,000 per day
Outflow Rate Limits Spark Core The outflow rate limits are:
  • maxAmount: 500,000,000
  • slope: 200,000,000 per day
Off-chain Operational Parameters Spark Core The documents herein contain specific off-chain parameters for this Instance.
Instance-specific Operational Processes Spark Core The documents herein defines the operations performed to manage the Ethena Instance, including rate limiting, role-based access control, and cooldown functionality.
Delegated Signers Spark Core The documents herein contain the addresses authorized as delegatedSigners in the ethenaMinter contract. delegatedSigners are set up and removed in the MainnetController contract by the Relayer role.
Addresses Of Delegated Signers Spark Core delegatedSigner addresses
  • These addesses will be specified in a future iteration of the Spark Artifact.
Set A Delegated Signer In The EthenaMinter Contract Spark Core The documents herein define the process for an operator to set a delegated signer to the EthenaMinter contract.
Relayer Role Spark Core The operator must ensure they are working as a RELAYER. Only the RELAYER role is allowed to setDelegatedSigner. Also, they must ensure the contract isActive i.e. can process the request. 

              function setDelegatedSigner(address delegatedSigner)
                external
                onlyRole(RELAYER)
                isActive
Encode Function Spark Core The operator must use proxy.doCall() to forward the call to the ethenaMinter contract and call setDelegatedSigner function to set the address that will be authorized as a delegatedSigner. To call on ethenaMinter contract, the function must be encoded using abi.encodeCall. 

              {
                proxy.doCall(
                  address(ethenaMinter),
                  abi.encodeCall(ethenaMinter.setDelegatedSigner, (address(delegatedSigner)))
                );
              }
Remove A Delegated Signer In The Ethena Minter Contract Spark Core The documents herein define the process for an operator to remove a delegated signer from the Ethena Minter contract.
Relayer Role Spark Core The operator must ensure they are working as a RELAYER. Only the RELAYER role is allowed to removeDelegatedSigner. Also, they must ensure the contract isActive i.e. can process the request. 

              function removeDelegatedSigner(address delegatedSigner)
                external
                onlyRole(RELAYER)
                isActive
Encode Function Spark Core The operator must use proxy.doCall() to forward the call to the ethenaMinter contract and call removeDelegatedSigner function to remove the authorization for the address to act as a delegatedSigner. To call on ethenaMinter contract, the function must be encoded using abi.encodeCall. 

              {
                proxy.doCall(
                  address(ethenaMinter),
                  abi.encodeCall(ethenaMinter.removeDelegatedSigner, (address(delegatedSigner)))
                );
              }
Approve Minting of USDe By Ethena Minter Contract Spark Core The documents herein define the process for an operator to approve the minting of USDe by the EthenaMinter contract.
Relayer Role Spark Core The operator must ensure they are working as a RELAYER. Only the RELAYER role is allowed to prepareUSDeMint. Also, they must ensure the contract isActive i.e. can process the request. 

              function prepareUSDeMint(uint256 usdcAmount)
                external
                onlyRole(RELAYER)
                isActive
Enforce Rate Limit Spark Core The operator must enforce a rate limit on how much USDC can be approved for minting USDe. 

              rateLimited(LIMIT_USDE_MINT, usdcAmount)
Encode Function Spark Core The operator must use proxy.doCall() to send an approval call to the usdc contract, allowing the ethenaMinter contract to spend up to the specified amount of USDC. They must encode the function using abi.encodeCall. 

              {
                proxy.doCall(
                  address(usdc),
                  abi.encodeCall(usdc.approve, (address(ethenaMinter), usdcAmount))
                );
              }
Approve Burning of USDe By EthenaMinter Contract Spark Core The documents herein define the process for an operator to approve the burning of USDe by the EthenaMinter contract.
Relayer Role Spark Core The operator must ensure they are working as a RELAYER. Only the RELAYER role is allowed to prepareUSDeBurn. Also, they must ensure the contract isActive i.e. can process the request. 

              function prepareUSDeBurn(uint256 usdeAmount)
                external
                onlyRole(RELAYER)
                isActive
Enforce Rate Limit Spark Core The operator must enforce a rate limit on how much USDe can be approved for burning. 

              rateLimited(LIMIT_USDE_BURN, usdeAmount)
Encode Function Spark Core The operator must use proxy.doCall() to send an approval call to the usde contract, allowing the ethenaMinter contract to spend up to the specified amount of USDe. They must encode the function using abi.encodeCall. 

              {
                proxy.doCall(
                  address(usde),
                  abi.encodeCall(usde.approve, (address(ethenaMinter), usdeAmount))
                );
              }
Ethereum Mainnet - Ethena sUSDe Instance Configuration Document Spark Core The documents herein contain the Instance Configuration Document for the Ethena sUSDe Instance.
RRC Framework Full Implementation Spark Core Pending
Parameters Spark Core The documents herein define the parameters of the Ethena sUSDe Instance of the Allocation System Primitive.
Instance Identifiers Spark Core The documents herein define the Instance identifiers
Network Spark Core Ethereum Mainnet
Target Protocol Spark Core Ethena Protocol
Asset Supplied By SLL Spark Core USDe
Token Spark Core sUSDe
Contract Addresses Spark Core The documents herein define the Instance contract addresses.
Token Address Spark Core 0x9D39A5DE30e57443BfF2A8307A4256c8797A3497
Underlying Asset Address Spark Core 0x4c9edd5852cd905f086c759e8383e09bff1e68b3
EthenaMinter Spark Core 0xe3490297a08d6fC8Da46Edb7B6142E4F461b62D3
Rate Limit IDs Spark Core The specific RateLimitID(s) for this conduit's inflow and outflow will be specified in a future iteration of the Spark Artifact.
Rate Limits Spark Core The current maxAmount and slope for this conduit's inflow/outflow are defined in the subdocuments herein.
Inflow Rate Limits Spark Core The inflow rate limits are:
  • maxAmount: 250,000,000
  • slope: 100,000,000 per day
Outflow Rate Limits Spark Core The outflow rate limits are:
  • maxAmount: unlimited
  • slope: unlimited
Instance-specific Operational Processes Spark Core For operational processes defining the operations performed to manage the Ethena Instance, including rate limiting, role-based access control, and minting of USDe functionality see Instance-specific Operational Processes. For detailed logic specific for this instance see Initiate A sUSDe Cooldown Period, Cool Down sUSDe Shares, Unstake sUSDe And Return It To ALM Proxy and Emergency Procedure To Withdraw Ethena Balances.
Initiate A sUSDe Cooldown Period Spark Core The documents herein define the process for an operator to initiate a sUSDe Cooldown period.
Relayer Role Spark Core The operator must ensure they are working as a RELAYER. Only the RELAYER role is allowed to cooldownAssetsSUSDe. Also, they must ensure the contract isActive i.e. can process the request. 

              function cooldownAssetsSUSDe(uint256 usdeAmount)
                external
                onlyRole(RELAYER)
                isActive
Enforce Rate Limit Spark Core The operator must enforce a rate limit on how much sUSDe can be cooled down. 

              rateLimited(LIMIT_SUSDE_COOLDOWN, usdeAmount)
Encode Function Spark Core The operator must use proxy.doCall() to make a call to the susde contract, invoking the cooldownAssets function with the specified amount of sUSDe. They must encode the function using abi.encodeCall. 

              {
                proxy.doCall(
                  address(susde),
                  abi.encodeCall(susde.cooldownAssets, (usdeAmount))
                );
              }
Cool Down sUSDe Shares Spark Core The documents herein define the process for an operator to cool down sUSDe shares.
Relayer Role Spark Core The operator must ensure they are working as a RELAYER. Only the RELAYER role is allowed to cooldownSharesSUSDe. Also, they must ensure the contract isActive i.e. can process the request. 

              function cooldownSharesSUSDe(uint256 susdeAmount)
                external
                onlyRole(RELAYER)
                isActive
Encode Function Spark Core The operator must use proxy.doCall() to make a call to the susde contract, initiating the cooldown on the specified amount of sUSDe shares. They must encode the function using abi.encodeCall.
Decode For Underlying Shares Spark Core The operator must decode the result returned by the cooldownShares function into a uint256 value, representing the amount of shares that were actually cooled down (cooldownAmount). 

              {
                cooldownAmount = abi.decode(
                  proxy.doCall(
                    address(susde),
                    abi.encodeCall(susde.cooldownShares, (susdeAmount))
                  ),
                  (uint256)
                );
Decrease RateLimit Spark Core The operator must decrease the RateLimit, effectively reducing the available cooldown limit, based on the cooldownAmount. 

              rateLimits.triggerRateLimitDecrease(LIMIT_SUSDE_COOLDOWN, cooldownAmount);
              }
Unstake sUSDe And Return It To ALM Proxy Spark Core The documents herein define the process for an operator to unstake sUSDe and return it to the ALM Proxy.
Relayer Role Spark Core The operator must ensure they are working as a RELAYER. Only the RELAYER role is allowed to unstakeSUSDe. Also, they must ensure the contract isActive i.e. can process the request. 

              function unstakeSUSDe()
                external
                onlyRole(RELAYER)
                isActive
Encode Function Spark Core The operator must use proxy.doCall() to make a call to the susde contract to invoke the unstake function, which unstakes sUSDe and sends the resulting tokens back to the proxy address (i.e. ALM Proxy). They must encode the function using abi.encodeCall. 

              {
                proxy.doCall(
                  address(susde),
                  abi.encodeCall(susde.unstake, (address(proxy)))
                );
              }
Emergency Procedure To Withdraw Ethena Balances Spark Core In order to withdraw all Ethena balances, the operator must execute the following actions:
sUSDe Cooldown Action Spark Core The operator must start the cooldown for sUSDe using the following action: 

                  mainnetController.cooldownSharesSUSDe(susde.balanceOf(address(proxy))
For more detailed instructions on the code to execute this, see Cool Down sUSDe Shares.
sUSDe Unstake Action Spark Core The operator must unstake sUSDe using the following action: 

              mainnetController.unstakeSUSDe()
For more detailed instructions on the code to execute this, see Unstake sUSDe And Return It To ALM Proxy.
Fluid Spark Core The Ethereum Mainnet Instances of the Fluid Protocol with Active Status are stored herein.
Ethereum Mainnet - Fluid sUSDS ERC4626 Vault Instance Configuration Document Spark Core The documents herein contain the Instance Configuration Document for the Fluid sUSDS ERC4626 Instance.
RRC Framework Full Implementation Spark Core Pending
Parameters Spark Core The documents herein define the parameters of the Fluid sUSDS ERC4626 Vault Instance of the Allocation System Primitive.
Instance Identifiers Spark Core The documents herein define the Instance identifiers
Network Spark Core Ethereum Mainnet
Target Protocol Spark Core Fluid Finance (ERC4626 Vault)
Asset Supplied By SLL Spark Core sUSDS
Token Spark Core fsUSDS
Contract Addresses Spark Core The documents herein define the Instance contract addresses.
Token Address Spark Core 0x2BBE31d63E6813E3AC858C04dae43FB2a72B0D11
Underlying Asset Address Spark Core 0xa3931d71877c0e7a3148cb7eb4463524fec27fbd
Rate Limit IDs Spark Core The specific RateLimitID(s) for this conduit's inflow and outflow will be specified in a future iteration of the Spark Artifact.
Rate Limits Spark Core The current maxAmount and slope for this conduit's inflow/outflow are defined in the subdocuments herein.
Inflow Rate Limits Spark Core The inflow rate limits are:
  • maxAmount: 10,000,000
  • slope: 5,000,000
Outflow Rate Limits Spark Core The outflow rate limits are:
  • maxAmount: 10,000,000
  • slope: 5,000,000
Off-chain Operational Parameters Spark Core The documents herein contain specific off-chain parameters for this Instance.
Instance-specific Operational Processes Spark Core The Instance follows the general ERC4626 procedures see ERC-4626 Functions and for emergency procedures see ERC-4626 Withdrawal Action. For detailed example of the SLL interaction logic for depositing to, withdrawing from, and redeeming from this ERC4626 vault instance see Deposit ERC-4626 Tokens and Withdraw ERC-4626 Tokens.
Deposit ERC-4626 Tokens Spark Core The documents herein define the steps for an operator to deposit assets from the ALM Proxy to the ERC-4626 vault (e.g., [Instance_Fluid_USDS_Vault_Address_Placeholder]) to receive yield-bearing shares.
Relayer Role Spark Core The operator must ensure they are working as a RELAYER. Only the RELAYER role is allowed to depositERC4626 tokens. Also, they must ensure the contract isActive i.e. can process the request. 

              function depositERC4626(address token, uint256 amount)
                external
                onlyRole(RELAYER)
                isActive
Check ALM Proxy Spark Core The operator must ensure the ALM Proxy holds enough of the underlying asset (e.g., [Instance_USDS_Address_Placeholder]) to cover the instructed deposit amount.
Check RateLimits Spark Core The operator must ensure the deposit amount is allowed within the RateLimits for this instance (e.g., using [Instance_RateLimitID_Deposit_Placeholder] for token [Instance_Fluid_USDS_Vault_Address_Placeholder]). 

                rateLimited(
                  RateLimitHelpers.makeAssetKey([Instance_RateLimitID_Deposit_Placeholder], [Instance_Fluid_USDS_Vault_Address_Placeholder]),,
                  amount
                )
                returns (uint256 shares)
              {
                // Note that whitelist is done by rate limits
                IERC20 asset = IERC20(IERC4626([Instance_Fluid_USDS_Vault_Address_Placeholder]).asset());
Update Allowance of Asset Contract Spark Core The operator must call the approve ERC-4626 function to update the allowance of the asset contract.
Encode Function Call Spark Core The operator must encode the function call to the ERC-4626 approve method, using abi.encodeCall to allow the token address ([Instance_Fluid_USDS_Vault_Address_Placeholder]) spend up to amount of a token from ALM Proxy's balance.
Send Encoded Call Spark Core The operator must send the encoded call using proxy.doCall() specifying the address of the asset contract ([Instance_USDS_Address_Placeholder]) they want to deposit into. 

              // Approve asset to token from the proxy (assumes the proxy has enough of the asset).
              proxy.doCall(
                address(asset),
                abi.encodeCall(asset.approve, ([Instance_Fluid_USDS_Vault_Address_Placeholder], amount))
              );
Deposit Assets Spark Core The operator must call the deposit ERC-4626 function to transfer the underlying asset to ERC-4626 token and receive vault shares.
Encode Function Call Spark Core The operator must encode the function call to ERC-4626 deposit method, using abi.encodeCall with the address of the ERC-4626 token vault ([Instance_Fluid_USDS_Vault_Address_Placeholder]), the amount of the underlying asset to deposit and the address(proxy) that will receive the resulting shares (i.e. ALM Proxy).
Send Encoded Call Spark Core The operator must send the encoded call using proxy.doCall() to the deposit function on the ERC-4626 vault contract (token).
Decode Vault Shares Spark Core The operator must decode the raw bytes data returned from the doCall() function into uint256 value, representing the number of vault shares minted from the deposit. 

                // Deposit asset into the token, proxy receives token shares, decode the resulting shares
                shares = abi.decode(
                  proxy.doCall(
                    [Instance_Morpho_Fluid_Vault_Address_Placeholder],,
                    abi.encodeCall(IERC4626([Instance_Fluid_USDS_Vault_Address_Placeholder]).deposit, (amount, address(proxy)))
                  ),
                  (uint256)
                );
              }
Withdraw ERC-4626 Tokens Spark Core The documents herein define the steps for an operator to withdraw a yield-earning balance from the ERC-4626 vault (e.g., [Instance_Fluid_USDS_Vault_Address_Placeholder]) to the ALM Proxy.
Relayer Role Spark Core The operator must ensure they are working as a RELAYER. Only the RELAYER role is allowed to withdrawERC4626 tokens. Also, they must ensure the contract isActive i.e. can process the request. 

              function withdrawERC4626(address token, uint256 amount)
                external
                onlyRole(RELAYER)
                isActive
Check ALM Proxy Spark Core The operator must ensure that the ALM Proxy holds sufficient shares of the ERC-4626 vault token ([Instance_Fluid_USDS_Vault_Address_Placeholder]) to cover the instructed withdraw amount.
Check RateLimits Spark Core The operator must ensure the withdraw amount is allowed within the RateLimits for this instance (e.g. using [Instance_RateLimitID_Withdraw_Placeholder] for token [Instance_Fluid_USDS_Vault_Address_Placeholder]). 

              // Check withdrawal limits.
                rateLimited(
                  RateLimitHelpers.makeAssetKey([Instance_RateLimitID_Withdraw_Placeholder], [Instance_Fluid_USDS_Vault_Address_Placeholder]),
                  amount
                )
                returns (uint256 shares)
Receive Vault Shares Spark Core The operator must call the withdraw ERC-4626 function to withdraw a required amount of underlying assets from an ERC-4626 vault and receive the corresponding vault shares.
Encode Function Call Spark Core The operator must encode the function call to the ERC-4626 withdraw method, using abi.encodeCall with the address of the ERC-4626 token vault ([Instance_Fluid_USDS_Vault_Address_Placeholder]), the amount of the underlying asset to withdraw and the address(proxy) of the recipient of the withdrawn assets and the sender of the shares (i.e. ALM Proxy).
Send Encoded Call Spark Core The operator must send the encoded call using proxy.doCall() to the withdraw function on the ERC-4626 vault contract (token).
Decode Token Shares Spark Core The operator must decode the raw bytes data returned from the doCall() function into uint256 value, representing the number of token shares burned in the withdrawal. 

              {
                // Withdraw asset from a token, decode resulting shares.
                // Assumes proxy has adequate token shares.
                shares = abi.decode(
                  proxy.doCall(
                    [Instance_Morpho_Fluid_Vault_Address_Placeholder],,
                    abi.encodeCall(IERC4626(token).withdraw, (amount, address(proxy), address(proxy)))
                  ),
                  (uint256)
                );
              }
Redeem Vault Shares For Assets Spark Core The operator must call the redeem ERC-4626 function to redeem a specific number of vault shares for the underlying asset.
Encode Function Call Spark Core The operator must encode the function call to the ERC-4626 redeem method, using abi.encodeCall with the address of the ERC-4626 token vault([Instance_Morpho_USDS_Vault_Address_Placeholder]), the shares to redeem and the address(proxy) of the receiver of redeemed assets and the owner of shares being received (i.e. ALM Proxy).
Send Encoded Call Spark Core The operator must send the encoded call using proxy.doCall() to the redeem function on the ERC-4626 vault contract (token).
Decode For Underlying Assets Spark Core The operator must decode the raw bytes data returned from the doCall() function into uint256 value, representing the number of underlying assets received for the redeemed shares. 

              function redeemERC4626(address token, uint256 shares)
                  external onlyRole(RELAYER) isActive returns (uint256 assets)
                {
                  // Redeem shares for assets from the token, decode the resulting assets.
                  // Assumes proxy has adequate token shares.
                  assets = abi.decode(
                    proxy.doCall(
                      [Instance_Fluid_USDS_Vault_Address_Placeholder],
                      abi.encodeCall(IERC4626([Instance_Fluid_USDS_Vault_Address_Placeholder]).redeem, (shares, address(proxy), address(proxy)))
                    ),
                    (uint256)
                  );
Decrease RateLimit Spark Core The operator must decrease the RateLimit based on the assets redeemed. 

                rateLimits.triggerRateLimitDecrease(
                  RateLimitHelpers.makeAssetKey([Instance_RateLimitID_Withdraw_Placeholder], [Instance_Fluid_USDS_Vault_Address_Placeholder]),
                  assets
                );
              }

Rate Limit IDs Spark Core The specific RateLimitID(s) for this conduit's inflow and outflow will be specified in a future iteration of the Spark Artifact.
Rate Limits Spark Core The current maxAmount, slope and slippage for this conduit's inflow/outflow/swap are defined in the subdocuments herein.
Inflow Rate Limits Spark Core The inflow rate limits are:
  • maxAmount: 5,000,000
  • slope (per day): 20,000,000
  • Max slippage: 0.15%
Outflow Rate Limits Spark Core The outflow rate limits are:
  • maxAmount: 5,000,000
  • slope: 20,000,000
  • Max slippage: 0.15%
Swap Rate Limits Spark Core The swap rate limits are:
  • maxAmount: 5,000,000
  • slope: 20,000,000
  • Max slippage: 0.15%

Morpho Spark Core The Ethereum Mainnet Instances of the Morpho Protocol with Active Status are stored herein.
Ethereum Mainnet - Morpho Dai Instance Configuration Document Spark Core The documents herein contain the Instance Configuration Document for the Morpho Dai Instance.
RRC Framework Full Implementation Spark Core Pending
Parameters Spark Core The documents herein define the parameters of the Morpho Dai Instance of the Allocation System Primitive.
Instance Identifiers Spark Core The documents herein define the Instance identifiers
Network Spark Core Ethereum Mainnet

Invocations that are completed successfully are moved to Active Instances Directory, whereas failed Invocations are Archived in Hub Data Repository.

Omni Documents Spark Core The documents herein define Spark's strategic intent and operational processes relating to infrastructure inherited from Sky Core, activities unrelated to Sky Primitives, or activities spanning multiple Sky Primitives.
Governance Information Unrelated To Root Edit Primitive Spark Core The documents herein specify Spark governance information that is unrelated to the use of the Root Edit Primitive. The governance process for updating the Spark Artifact is specified in the Root Edit Primitive above at Root Edit Primitive.
Sky Forum Spark Core Spark uses the Sky Forum for governance-related discussion. Posts should use the "Spark" tag.
Discord Spark Core Spark also uses Discord for more immediate communication. The Spark Discord is located at https://t.co/v6zG0MZtak.
Sky Ecosystem Emergency Response Spark Core The documents herein specify Spark's emergency response protocol in situations that impact the entire Sky Ecosystem. This protocol will be specified in a future iteration of the Spark Artifact.
Agent-Specific Emergency Response Spark Core The documents herein specify Spark's emergency response protocol in situations solely impacting Spark versus the broader Sky Ecosystem. This protocol will be specified in a future iteration of the Spark Artifact.
Management Of Infrastructure Inherited From Sky Core Spark Core The documents herein specify Spark's strategy and operational processes for managing infrastructure inherited from Sky Core.
SparkLend Spark Core The documents herein define the parameters and operational processes related to SparkLend. Control of SparkLend is being transitioned to Spark.
Parameters Spark Core The parameters of SparkLend are specified in the subdocuments herein.
SparkLend Risk Parameters Definitions Spark Core The subdocuments herein provide definitions of the SparkLend risk parameters.
Borrow Rate Definition Spark Core The borrow rate is the annualized percentage yield for borrowing the asset, which is determined based on the market's Interest Rate Model and actual utilization in the market.
Supply Rate Definition Spark Core The supply rate is the annualized percentage yield for supplying the asset, which is determined based on borrow rate as:supply rate = market utilization * borrow rate * (1-reserve factor)
Interest Rate Model Definition Spark Core The Interest Rate Model ("IRM") is defined by four main parameters:1. Base Rate - the starting rate at 0% utilization, 2. Variable Slope 1 - the rate at optimal utilization, 3. Variable Slope 2 - the rate at 100% utilization, 4. Utilization - the utilization itself.
The Base Rate, Slope 1, and Slope 2 parameters are further defined in: Base Rate Definition; Slope 1 Definition; and Slope 2 Definition. All markets except Dai use this IRM. The IRM for Dai is independent of utilization and is defined as a spread over the Sky Savings Rate set forth in A.3.2 - Core Stability Parameters - Parameters - Sky Savings Rate. The spread is determined by the Stability Facilitators, in consultation with the Stability Scope Advisors.
LTV Definition Spark Core The LTV is the maximum percentage of the value of collateral that borrowers can borrow against their collateral.
Liquidation Threshold Definition Spark Core The liquidation threshold is the maximum debt a borrower can owe as a percentage of their collateral before their position is considered under-collateralized and thus at risk of being liquidated.
High Efficiency Mode Category Definition Spark Core The High Efficiency Mode Category groups assets that are highly correlated with each other into buckets, for example Stablecoins or various forms of ETH. Borrowing against an asset to acquire another asset in the same category can support higher LTVs and liquidation thresholds as determined by the protocol.
Liquidation Bonus Definition Spark Core The liquidation bonus is the bonus for liquidating an unhealthy loan, or equivalently the penalty for having an unhealthy loan liquidated. The party paying off the unhealthy loan is entitled to collateral with an equivalent value as the debt paid off plus the liquidation bonus.
Reserve Factor Definition Spark Core The reserve factor is the percentage of interest payments paid to the protocol.
Supply Cap Definition Spark Core The supply cap is the maximum amount of the asset that can be supplied.
Borrow Cap Definition Spark Core The borrow cap is the maximum amount of the asset that can be borrowed.
Optimal Utilization Definition Spark Core The optimal utilization represents the desired target utilization of the borrowing capacity for the asset. It is an input used to determine the interest rate of borrowing. When the actual utilization is above the optimal utilization, borrowing rates will be higher; and when the actual utilization is below the optimal utilization, borrowing rates will be lower.
Isolated Debt Ceiling Definition Spark Core The isolated debt ceiling represents the maximum amount that can be borrowed against designated isolated assets, as determined by the Stability Facilitators in consultation with the Stability Scope Advisors. Only Stablecoins may be borrowed against isolated assets.
Base Rate Definition Spark Core The base rate is an input used to determine the interest rate of borrowing. The base rate is adjusted based on actual borrowing utilization relative to optimal borrowing utilization to arrive at the actual borrowing rate.
Reserve State Definition Spark Core The reserve state represents the state of the market for a particular collateral type. The reserve state may be:• Active - all activities may occur• Frozen - all activities may occur except for supplying and borrowing• Paused - no activities may occur
Slope 1 Definition Spark Core Slope 1 is the interest rate at optimal utilization in the Interest Rate Model.
Slope 1 Spread Definition Spark Core The Slope 1 Spread is the difference between the WETH interest rate at optimal utilization in the Interest Rate Model and the staking yield on stETH. The Slope 1 Spread Parameter is only defined for WETH.
Slope 2 Definition Spark Core Slope 2 is the interest rate at 100% utilization in the Interest Rate Model.
Collateral-Enabled Definition Spark Core If Collateral is Enabled, then the asset may be used as collateral.
Borrowing-Enabled Definition Spark Core If Borrowing is Enabled, then the asset may be borrowed.
Isolated Collateral-Enabled Definition Spark Core If Isolated Collateral is Enabled, only Stablecoins can be borrowed when using the asset as collateral.
Isolation Mode Definition Spark Core When a user is in Isolation Mode, only assets with Isolated Borrow enabled can be borrowed.
Siloed Borrowing-Enabled Definition Spark Core If Siloed Borrowing is Enabled, then when borrowing the asset, no other asset may be borrowed.
Flash Loan Enabled Definition Spark Core If the Flash Loan Enabled parameter is activated, then the asset may be borrowed using a flash loan.
Total Flash Loan Fee Definition Spark Core The Total Flash Loan Fee incorporates a fee paid to the protocol and a fee paid to liquidity providers. This total fee is calculated as a percentage of the flash loan amount. Of the Total Flash Loan Fee, the Protocol Flash Loan Fee is paid to the protocol, with the remainder paid to liquidity providers. The Total Flash Loan Fee is set on a protocol level, regardless of what assets are being borrowed.
Protocol Flash Loan Fee Definition Spark Core The Protocol Flash Loan Fee is the fee for a flash loan paid to the protocol as a percentage of the flash loan amount. The Protocol Flash Loan Fee is set on a protocol level, regardless of what assets are being borrowed.
SparkLend Risk Parameters Current Configuration Spark Core The subdocuments herein define the current configuration of the SparkLend risk parameters.
GNO Risk Parameters Spark Core The current GNO risk parameters are:• LTV: 0%• Liquidation Threshold: 25%• E-mode Category: N/A• Liquidation Bonus: 10%• Reserve Factor: 0%• Supply Cap: N/A• Borrow Cap: N/A• Optimal Utilization: 100%• Isolated Debt Ceiling: $5,000,000• Base Rate: 1%• Slope 1: 0%• Slope 2: 0%• Reserve State: Frozen• Collateral: Yes• Borrowing: No• Isolated Collateral: Yes• Isolated Borrowing: No• Siloed Borrowing: No• Flash Loan Enabled: No
Dai Risk Parameters Spark Core The current Dai risk parameters are:• LTV: 0%• Liquidation Threshold: 0.01%• E-mode Category: N/A• Liquidation Bonus: 4.5%• Reserve Factor: 0%• Supply Cap: N/A• Borrow Cap: N/A• Optimal Utilization: 80%• Isolated Debt Ceiling: N/A• Base Rate: 0%• Slope 1: SSR + 0.75%• Slope 2: 15%• Reserve State: Active• Collateral: Yes• Borrowing: Yes• Isolated Collateral: No• Isolated Borrowing: Yes• Siloed Borrowing: No• Flash Loan Enabled: Yes.
The Dai Borrow Rate is set through the Interest Rate Model as a spread over the Sky Savings Rate. The spread is set directly by the Stability Facilitators in consultation with the Stability Scope Advisors.
USDS Risk Parameters Spark Core The current USDS risk parameters are:• LTV: 0%• Liquidation Threshold: 0%• E-mode Category: N/A• Liquidation Bonus: 10%• Reserve Factor: 0%• Supply Cap: Unlimited• Borrow Cap: Unlimited• Optimal Utilization: 80%• Isolated Debt Ceiling: N/A• Base Rate: 0%• Slope 1: SSR + 0.75%• Slope 2: 15%• Reserve State: Active• Collateral: Yes• Borrowing: Yes• Isolated Collateral: No• Isolated Borrowing: Yes• Siloed Borrowing: No• Flash Loan Enabled: No.
The USDS Borrow Rate is set through the Interest Rate Model as a spread over the Sky Savings Rate. The spread is set directly by the Stability Facilitators in consultation with the Stability Scope Advisors.
WETH Risk Parameters Spark Core The current WETH risk parameters are:• LTV: 82%• Liquidation Threshold: 83%• E-mode Category: ETH• Liquidation Bonus: 5%• Reserve Factor: 5%• Supply Cap: Set by cap automator• Borrow Cap: Set by cap automator• Optimal Utilization: 90%• Isolated Debt Ceiling: N/A• Base Rate: 0%• Slope 1: N/A• Slope 1 Spread: -0.50%• Slope 2: 120%• Reserve State: Active• Collateral: Yes• Borrowing: Yes• Isolated Collateral: No• Isolated Borrowing: No• Siloed Borrowing: No• Flash Loan Enabled: YesThe Slope 1 parameter for WETH is calculated based on the following formula:slope 1 = stETH yield + slope 1 spread - base rate
USDT Risk Parameters Spark Core The current USDT risk parameters are:• LTV: 0%• Liquidation Threshold: 0%• E-mode Category: USD• Liquidation Bonus: 0%• Reserve Factor: 5%• Supply Cap: 30,000,000 USDT• Borrow Cap: Set by cap automator• Optimal Utilization: 95%• Isolated Debt Ceiling: N/A• Base Rate: 0%• Slope 1: SSR value plus 1%• Slope 2: 15%• Reserve State: Active• Collateral: No• Borrowing: Yes• Isolated Collateral: No• Isolated Borrowing: No• Siloed Borrowing: No• Flash Loan Enabled: Yes

Total Flash Loan Fee Current Value Spark Core The Total Flash Loan Fee is 0.00%.
Protocol Flash Loan Fee Current Value Spark Core The Protocol Flash Loan Fee is 0.00%.
cbBTC Risk Parameters Spark Core The current cbBTC risk parameters are:• LTV: 74%• Liquidation Threshold: 75%• E-mode Category: N/A• Liquidation Bonus: 8%• Reserve Factor: 20%• Supply Cap: 500 cbBTC• Borrow Cap: 50 cbBTC• Optimal Utilization: 80%• Isolated Debt Ceiling: N/A• Base Rate: 0%• Slope 1: 1%• Slope 2: 300%• Reserve State: Active• Collateral: Yes• Borrowing: Yes• Isolated Collateral: No• Isolated Borrowing: No• Siloed Borrowing: No
sUSDS Risk Parameters Spark Core The current sUSDS risk parameters are:• LTV: 79%• Liquidation Threshold: 80%• E-mode Category: N/A• Liquidation Bonus: 5%• Reserve Factor: 10%• Supply Cap: 50,000,000 sUSDS• Borrow Cap: 0 sUSDS• Optimal Utilization: 80%• Isolated Debt Ceiling: N/A• Base Rate: 0%• Slope 1: 2%• Slope 2: 300%• Reserve State: Active• Collateral: Yes• Borrowing: No• Isolated Collateral: No• Isolated Borrowing: No• Siloed Borrowing: No
SparkLend Risk Parameters Cap Automators Spark Core Cap Automators allow the Supply Cap defined in Supply Cap Definition and the Borrow Cap defined in Borrow Cap Definition to be dynamically adjusted. The cap automator is defined in terms of three parameters:1. gap - the target available exposure2. ttl - the cooldown period for cap increases3. max - the absolute maximum exposureAny user can permissionlessly update a covered Supply Cap or Borrow Cap so the available exposure is equal to the target, as long as the resulting exposure does not exceed the specified maximum limit and the cooldown period has elapsed in the case of increases to the Supply Cap or Borrow Cap.
SparkLend Risk Parameters Cap Automator Parameter Definitions Spark Core The subdocuments herein define the parameters of the Cap Automators.
SparkLend Risk Parameters Cap Automator Target Available Exposure Definition Spark Core The gap parameter is the target gap between the supply usage and the Supply Cap, in the case of the Supply Cap, or between the borrow usage and the Borrow Cap, in the case of the Borrow Cap.
SparkLend Risk Parameters Cap Automator Cooldown Period Definition Spark Core The ttl parameters is the minimum time requirement before it is possible to increase the Supply Cap or Borrow Cap, expressed in seconds.
SparkLend Risk Parameters Cap Automator Absolute Maximum Exposure Definition Spark Core The max parameter is the maximum the Supply Cap or Borrow Cap can be increased to.
SparkLend Cap Automator Current Configuration Spark Core The subdocuments herein define the current configuration of the cap automators for each covered market.
SparkLend Cap Automator WETH Parameters Spark Core The current WETH cap automator parameters are:• Supply cap ◦ gap: 150,000 WETH ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 2 million WETH• Borrow cap ◦ gap: 10,000 WETH ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 1 million WETH
SparkLend Cap Automator wstETH Parameters Spark Core The current wstETH cap automator parameters are:• Supply cap ◦ gap: 50,000 wstETH ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 1.2 million wstETH• Borrow cap ◦ gap: 10,000 wstETH ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 1,000,000 wstETH
SparkLend Cap Automator rETH Parameters Spark Core The current rETH cap automator parameters are:• Supply cap ◦ gap: 10,000 rETH ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 80,000 rETH• Borrow cap ◦ gap: 100 rETH ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 2,400 rETH
SparkLend Cap Automator WBTC Parameters Spark Core The current WBTC cap automator parameters are:• Supply cap ◦ gap: 200 WBTC ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 5,000 WBTC• Borrow cap ◦ gap: 1 WBTC ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 1 WBTC
SparkLend Cap Automator sDai Parameters Spark Core The current sDai cap automator parameters are:• Supply cap ◦ gap: 50 million sDai ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 1 billion sDai• Borrow cap: n/a - not a borrowable asset ◦ gap: n/a ◦ ttl: n/a ◦ max: 0 sDAI
SparkLend Cap Automator USDC Parameters Spark Core The current USDC cap automator parameters are:• Supply cap ◦ gap: 150 million USDC ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 1 billion USDC• Borrow cap ◦ gap: 50 million USDC ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 950 million USDC
SparkLend Cap Automator USDT Parameters Spark Core The current USDT cap automator parameters are:• Supply cap ◦ gap: 100 million USDT◦ ttl: n/a ◦ max: 500 million USDT• Borrow cap ◦ gap: 50 million USDT ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 450 million USDT
SparkLend Cap Automator cbBTC Parameters Spark Core The current cbBTC cap automator parameters are:• Supply cap ◦ gap: 500 cbBTC ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 3,000 cbBTC• Borrow cap ◦ gap: 50 cbBTC ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 500 cbBTC
SparkLend Cap Automator sUSDS Parameters Spark Core The current sUSDS cap automator parameters are:• Supply cap ◦ gap: 50 millions sUSDS ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 500 million sUSDS• Borrow cap ◦ gap: N/A ◦ ttl: N/A ◦ max: N/A
SparkLend Cap Automator weETH Parameters Spark Core The current weETH cap automator parameters are:• Supply cap ◦ gap: 10,000 weETH ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 500,000 weETH• Borrow cap ◦ gap: N/A ◦ ttl: N/A ◦ max: N/A
SparkLend Cap Automator LBTC Parameters Spark Core The current LBTC cap automator parameters are:• Supply cap ◦ gap: 250 LBTC ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 2,500 LBTC• Borrow cap ◦ gap: N/A ◦ ttl: N/A ◦ max: N/A
SparkLend Cap Automator tBTC Parameters Spark Core The current tBTC cap automator parameters are:• Supply cap ◦ gap: 125 tBTC ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 500 tBTC• Borrow cap ◦ gap: 25 tBTC ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 250 tBTC
SparkLend Cap Automator ezETH Parameters Spark Core The current ezETH cap automator parameters are:• Supply cap ◦ gap: 2,000 ezETH ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 20,000 ezETH• Borrow cap ◦ gap: N/A ◦ ttl: N/A ◦ max: N/A
SparkLend Cap Automator rsETH Parameters Spark Core The current rsETH cap automator parameters are:• Supply cap ◦ gap: 5,000 rsETH ◦ ttl: 12 hours ◦ max: 40,000 rsETH• Borrow cap ◦ gap: N/A ◦ ttl: N/A ◦ max: N/A
SparkLend Risk Parameters Kill Switch Spark Core The kill switch disables all borrowing across SparkLend markets in the event of a depeg on key collateral assets. The kill switch is defined in terms of a threshold for specified pegged assets. If the ratio of the price of a specified asset to its peg is equal to or less than the threshold, then any user can trigger the kill switch to disable borrowing across all SparkLend markets. After the kill switch is triggered, markets can be reactivated by Sky Governance after resetting the kill switch. Resetting the kill switch is subject to the Governance Security Delay specified in A.1.9 - A2 - Sky Core Governance Security - Governance Security Delay Requirements.
SparkLend Risk Parameters Kill Switch Current Configuration Spark Core The kill switch currently covers the following assets with the specified thresholds:• STETH/ETH - 0.95
Operational Process Definition Spark Core The documents herein define the process for the ongoing management of SparkLend. Future iterations of the Artifact will specify operational processes owned by Spark.
SparkLend Risk Parameters Modification Spark Core The modification of SparkLend parameters is temporarily controlled by Sky Core, but will be transitioned to Spark in the future. Currently, the Stability Facilitators, in consultation with the Stability Scope Advisors and Phoenix Labs, may recommend changes to any of the parameters specified in the subdocuments of SparkLend Risk Parameters Definitions or SparkLend Risk Parameters Cap Automator Parameter Definitions. As a general rule, the modification of said parameters is pursuant to the Operational Weekly Cycle and can be effected directly via an Executive Vote, without requiring a Governance Poll. Changes to the parameters defined in the following documents are exceptions to the general rule and require a Governance Poll followed by an Executive Vote: • Liquidation Threshold Definition • Liquidation Bonus Definition
Collateral Onboarding/Offboarding Spark Core The onboarding/offboarding of SparkLend collateral is temporarily controlled by Sky Core, but will be transitioned to Spark in the future. Currently, it is implemented by the Stability Facilitators, in consultation with the Stability Scope Advisors and Phoenix Labs, through the Operational Weekly Cycle.
Spark Protocol-Aave Revenue Share Spark Core Spark Protocol must pay out 10% of the income it generates from operating the borrowing and lending functionality of the protocol that is based on the Aave codebase. The documents herein define the Spark Protocol-Aave Revenue Share and its associated operational processes.
Sky Core Governance Responsibility For Virtual Revenue Share Prior to Launch of SPK Spark Core Before the launch of Agent tokens, Sky Governance is temporarily responsible for paying out a "virtual revenue share" on behalf of Spark Protocol. It is calculated by taking the total amount of Dai borrowed from Spark Protocol, and then assuming a "virtual income" equivalent to 1% of this supply, and calculating a revenue share of 10% on that basis. The calculations and payments must be done manually by the Support Facilitators at the end of each quarter. As an example: if, before the launch of Agent tokens, 200 million Dai is borrowed on Spark Protocol, then the virtual income is 1% of 200 million Dai, which gives 2 million Dai; and of that 2 million Dai the virtual revenue share is 200,000 Dai. This 200,000 Dai must be paid out in incremental payments each quarter directly by Sky Governance from the Sky Surplus Buffer to a smart contract under the control of Aave Governance. If, before the launch of Agent tokens, less than 100 million Dai is borrowed from Spark Protocol by the Sky Protocol, accrual towards the virtual revenue share payments are paused (unpaid virtual revenue share that already accrued is still paid out at the end of the quarter), and the counting down of the revenue share duration is paused. The virtual revenue share payments and the counting down of the remaining revenue share duration is resumed when at least 100 million Dai is again borrowed from Spark Protocol by the Sky Protocol. Once SPK tokens launch, the virtual revenue share system will be discontinued, and the standard rules of the Spark Protocol Aave Revenue Share Ecosystem Agreement shall take effect. See Standard Agreement Post SPK Launch.
Standard Agreement Post SPK Launch Spark Core Post SPK launch, the following revenue-share operational process takes effect. The revenue share payment must be calculated manually at the end of each quarter by the Spark and manually paid as Dai to a smart contract under the control of Aave Governance from Spark. The payments must occur for the revenue share duration of two (2) years, starting from September 25th, 2023. If at any point in time after the launch of Agent tokens, Spark Protocol is generating less than 1 million Dai per year in income for Spark Agent, accrual towards the revenue share payments are paused (unpaid revenue share that already accrued is still paid out at the end of the quarter), and the counting down of the revenue share duration is paused. The revenue share payments and the counting down of the remaining revenue share duration is resumed when Spark Protocol is generating more than 1 million Dai per year in income again.
Data Repository Spark Core The documents herein contain data relevant to SparkLend.
Spark Dai Direct Deposit Module Spark Core The documents herein define the parameters and operational processes related to the Spark Dai Direct Deposit Module. Spark is able to temporarily borrow Dai from Sky Core through the Spark Dai Direct Deposit Module (D3M). This will be replaced by borrowing at the Agents Credit Line Borrow Rate specified in after the launch of Agent Vaults and the development of a new Rate System.
Parameters Spark Core The parameters of the Spark Dai Direct Deposit Module are specified in the subdocuments herein.
Parameter Definitions Spark Core The subdocuments herein define the Spark Dai Direct Deposit Module parameters.
Target Available Debt Definition Spark Core The gap parameter is the target gap between the debt usage and the debt ceiling.
Debt Ceiling Increase Cooldown Definition Spark Core The ttl parameter is the minimum time requirement before it is possible to increase the debt ceiling, expressed in seconds.
Maximum Debt Ceiling Definition Spark Core The line is the maximum amount of debt that can be borrowed under the Spark Dai Direct Deposit Module.
Buffer Definition Spark Core buffer is a fixed-sized amount of pre-minted Dai which the Spark Dai Direct Deposit Module is designed to maintain in most situations.
Debt Write Off Timelock Definition Spark Core tau is the timelock required before bad debt can be written off after the Spark Dai Direct Deposit Module has been shut down, expressed in seconds.
Current Configuration Spark Core The current parameters of the Spark Dai Direct Deposit Module are:- gap: 40 million Dai- ttl: 24 hours- line: 2.5 billion Dai- buffer: 100 million Dai- tau: 7 days
Operational Process Definition Spark Core The documents herein define the process for the ongoing management of the Spark Dai Direct Deposit Module. Future iterations of the Artifact will specify operational processes owned by Spark.
Spark Dai Direct Deposit Module Ongoing Management Spark Core The Spark Dai Direct Deposit Module is managed by the Stability Facilitators, in consultation with the Stability Scope Advisors and Phoenix Labs.
Spark Deployment Of New Direct Deposit Modules Spark Core The Stability Facilitators can directly include the deployment of new Direct Deposit Modules in Executive Votes, with risk parameters defined by the Stability Facilitators. These parameters should be based on input from the Stability Scope Advisors and Phoenix Labs and should best serve the needs of the Sky Ecosystem and its collaboration with other protocols.
Data Repository Spark Core The documents herein contain data relevant to the Spark Dai Direct Deposit Module.
Spark Pre-launch Token Rewards Spark Core The subdocuments herein define the parameters and operational processes related to Spark's pre-launch token rewards program. These rewards will be paid exclusively out of the SPK tokens held by the Spark Foundation.
Parameters Spark Core The parameters of the Spark Pre-launch Token Rewards are specified in the subdocuments herein.
Conditions For The Pre-launch Token Rewards Spark Core Spark has a pre-launch token rewards program based on the usage of its lending platform. Users of the platform will receive an airdrop of SPK tokens, depending on how much and how long they have used the platform during the pre-launch token reward period. These rewards are only for users on Ethereum Mainnet. There are two seasons of the Spark pre-launch token rewards: Season 1 and Season 2. Season 1 of pre-launch token rewards was active from August 20 2023 and lasted for nine months, ending on May 20 2024. 130,434,783 SPK tokens were allocated in this period. In Season 2 14,478,261 SPK will be rewarded per month to SparkLend users who qualify for the airdrop. Season 2 is an additional pre-farming period, which runs until the Spark Agent launches as part of Sky Endgame launch season. The monthly SPK rewards are allocated as follows:◦ 80 % is allocated to users borrowing DAI and/or USDS◦ 20 % is allocated to users supplying ETHThe proposed full anti-cheat SPK Airdrop for SparkLend is calculated using the following formula:Airdrop = 80% * (DAI Borrows + USDS Borrows - sDAI Supplies * sDAI Liquidation Threshold - sUSDS Supplies * sUSDS Liquidation Threshold) + 20% * (ETH Supplies - ETH Borrows / ETH Liquidation Threshold)All supplies and borrows are denominated in USD based on the on-chain oracle price at that block to determine the conversion.
Operational Process Definition Spark Core The documents herein define the process for the ongoing management of the Spark Pre-launch Token Rewards.
Special Pre-launch Token Reward Programs Spark Core Spark can activate a new SPK token pre-launch token reward airdrop program to capture other growth opportunities. The program can last until the moment SPK launches, or a shorter duration. When activated, the exact details of the special pre-launch token reward airdrop program must be specified in Special Pre-launch Token Reward Program Details. The SPK tokens for the future Spark Airdrop are allocated between all borrowers based on a formula announced by Spark and specified in the above cited document. The rate of SPK tokens being earned is 7,239,130 SPK per month, distributed on a per block basis proportional to the formula specified in the above cited document.
Special Pre-launch Token Reward Program Details Spark Active Data Controller The special pre-launch token reward airdrop program is defined as Active Data in Special Pre-launch Token Reward Program Details. The Active Data is updated as follows:- The Responsible Party is Operational GovOps.- The Update Process must follow the protocol for 'Direct Edit'.
Data Repository Spark Core The documents herein contain data relevant to the Spark Pre-launch Token Rewards.

Ecosystem Accord 2 Spark Core Spark engaged in terms of agreement with Sky, Moonbow and Launch Agent 1 in Ecosystem Accord 2, located in A.2.10 - Ecosystem Accord 2: Launch Agent 1 And Spark - Star Program.
Launch Agent 1 Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein specify all of the logic for Launch Agent 1, including Launch Agent 1's strategy and how it uses the Sky Primitives to operationalize this strategy.
Introduction Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1 is an Agent initially focused on providing credit to crypto native and tokenized off-chain (RWA) opportunities in order to facilitate credit creation in the digital economy.

In Progress Invocations Launch Agent 1 Core The in progress Invocations of the Executor Accord Primitive are contained herein. Once an Invocation is successfully completed, its subtree will be moved to Active Instances.
Root Edit Primitive Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein contain all data and specifications for Launch Agent 1's Instance of the Root Edit Primitive. See A.2.4 - Root Edit Primitive.
Primitive Hub Document Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein organize all base information relevant to Launch Agent 1's usage of the Root Edit Primitive.
Global Activation Status Launch Agent 1 Core Active
Active Instances Directory Launch Agent 1 Core This document contains a Directory of all Instances of the Root Edit Primitive with Instance status of Active.
Single Instance Configuration Document Location Launch Agent 1 Core This Instance's associated Instance Configuration Document is located at Single Instance Configuration Document.
Completed Instances Directory Launch Agent 1 Core This document contains a Directory of all Instances of the Root Edit Primitive with Instance status of Completed.
In Progress Invocations Directory Launch Agent 1 Core Because the Root Edit Primitive is deployed only once, no further Instances of the Primitive can be Invoked.
Hub Data Repository Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein contain the Data Repository for the Primitive Hub Document.
Archived Invocations/Instances Launch Agent 1 Core The subtrees for archived Invocations and Instances of the Root Edit Primitive are stored here.
Failed Invocations Launch Agent 1 Core The subtrees for failed Invocations of the Root Edit Primitive are stored here.
Suspended Instances Launch Agent 1 Core The subtrees for Instances of the Root Edit Primitive with Suspended Status are stored here.
Active Instances Launch Agent 1 Core The Instances of the Root Edit Primitive with Active Status are stored herein.
Single Instance Configuration Document Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein contain the Instance Configuration Document for the Single Root Edit Primitive Instance.
Parameters Launch Agent 1 Core The parameters of the Root Edit Primitive are fully specified by the Operational Process Definition in Operational Process Definition.
Operational Process Definition Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define the process for using the Root Edit Primitive to update the Launch Agent 1 Agent Artifact. Information on Launch Agent 1 governance that is unrelated to the use of the Root Edit Primitive is located at Governance Information Unrelated To Root Edit Primitive.
Routine Protocol Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define the process for using the Root Edit Primitive to update the Launch Agent 1 Agent Artifact in routine or normal conditions (i.e., non-emergency situations).
Root Edit Proposal Submission Launch Agent 1 Core The Root Edit process begins with an AGENT1 token holder submitting a proposal through the Powerhouse system containing a draft Artifact Edit Proposal. An AGENT1 token holder must hold at least 1% of the circulating token supply to submit a proposal. The proposal must also be posted on the Sky Forum under the "Launch Agent 1" tag.
Root Edit Proposal Submission Requirements Exception Launch Agent 1 Core For proposals that solely entail a buyback or a grant of AGENT1 tokens, the requirement that AGENT1 token holders must hold at least 1% of the circulating token supply to submit a proposal is waived. However, all other procedural requirements within the Root Edit process continue to apply.
Root Edit Expert Advisor Review Launch Agent 1 Core A future iteration of the Launch Agent 1 Artifact will specify guidelines for obtaining specialized review of proposals requiring advanced technical or financial analysis.
Root Edit Proposal Review By Operational Facilitator Launch Agent 1 Core Within seven (7) days of the proposal being submitted, the Operational Facilitator must review the Root Edit Proposal for alignment. If the proposal is aligned, the Operational Facilitator must respond to the Forum post to announce their finding. In this Forum post, the Operational Facilitator must also confirm that the proposal is feasible for Operational GovOps to operationalize. If the proposal is misaligned, the Operational Facilitator must respond to the Forum post to announce their finding and provide the reasoning for it.
Root Edit Token Holder Vote Launch Agent 1 Core Where their review of the proposal results in a finding of alignment with the Sky Core Atlas and Launch Agent 1 Artifact, the Operational Facilitator next triggers a Snapshot poll to allow token holders to vote on the proposal. The poll is open for three (3) days. A poll must have at least 10% of the circulating token supply participating and must have 50% of votes in favor to be approved.
Root Edit Artifact Update Launch Agent 1 Core At the conclusion of the poll, if the proposal is approved, the Operational Facilitator submits the edit to Powerhouse to formally update the Agent Artifact. Regardless of the outcome, the Operational Facilitator updates the Powerhouse System to include the result of the vote, including any pertinent documents.
Artifact Edit Restrictions Launch Agent 1 Core The Launch Agent 1 Artifact cannot be edited in any way that violates the Sky Core Atlas or its specifications of the Sky Primitives, or in any way that is otherwise misaligned. The Operational Facilitator must enforce this rule through their review of Artifact Edit Proposals.
Non-Routine Protocol Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define the process for using the Root Edit Primitive to update the Launch Agent 1 Agent Artifact in non-routine conditions.
Emergency Protocol Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define the process for using the Root Edit Primitive to update the Launch Agent 1 Agent Artifact in urgent or emergency situations.
Root Edit Voting Process in Urgent and Emergency Situations Launch Agent 1 Core In an Urgent or Emergency Situation, as defined by the Sky Core Atlas in A.1.8 - Emergency Voting System - Definition Of Emergency Situations, the Operational Facilitator may allow a Root Edit to occur more quickly than the timeline specified above. Where feasible, the Operational Facilitator should announce the decision to deploy the emergency Root Edit protocol and provide their reasoning via a public Sky Forum post (under the "Launch Agent 1" tag), unless doing so would endanger Launch Agent 1 or its users.
Data Repository Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein contain data relevant to the Single Instance of the Root Edit Primitive.
Initial Planning Launch Agent 1 Core The materials associated with initial planning of the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Operational GovOps Review Launch Agent 1 Core The materials associated with Operational GovOps Review during the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Artifact Edit Proposal Launch Agent 1 Core The materials associated with preparing the Artifact Edit Proposal during the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Completed Instances Launch Agent 1 Core The Instances of the Root Edit Primitive with Completed Status are contained herein.
In Progress Invocations Launch Agent 1 Core Because the Root Edit Primitive is deployed only once, no further Instances of the Primitive can be Invoked.

Parameters Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define the parameters of the Single Instance of the Distribution Requirement Primitive.
Terms Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1 will buy back and distribute 0.25% of its total token supply per year.
Custom Instance Parameters Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define the custom parameters of the Single Instance of the Distribution Requirement Primitive, if any.

Routine Protocol Launch Agent 1 Core This document defines the protocol for routine ongoing management of the Single Instance of this Distribution Requirement Primitive.
Process Definition For Buy Back And Distribution Obligation Launch Agent 1 Core The process to buy back and distribute 0.25% of Launch Agent 1's tokens per year will be specified in future iterations of the Launch Agent 1 Artifact.

Upkeep Rebate Primitive Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein contain all data and specifications for Launch Agent 1's Instance of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive. See A.2.4 - Upkeep Rebate Primitive.
Primitive Hub Document Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein organize all base information relevant to Launch Agent 1's usage of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive.
Global Activation Status Launch Agent 1 Core Active
Active Instances Directory Launch Agent 1 Core This document contains a Directory of all Instances of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive with Instance status of Active.
Single Instance Configuration Document Location Launch Agent 1 Core This Instance's associated Instance Configuration Document is located at Single Instance Configuration Document.

Archived Invocations/Instances Launch Agent 1 Core The subtrees for archived Invocations and Instances of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive are stored here.

Single Instance Configuration Document Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein contain the Instance Configuration Document for the Single Upkeep Rebate Primitive Instance.
Parameters Launch Agent 1 Core Every Star Agent is entitled to the Upkeep Rebate Primitive for tokens of other Star Agents that they hold. Because this right automatically applies, there are no parameters.
Operational Process Definition Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define the process for the ongoing management of the Single Instance of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive.
Routine Protocol Launch Agent 1 Core This document defines the protocol for routine ongoing management of the Single Instance of this Upkeep Rebate Primitive.
Launch Agent 1 Holds Tokens Of Other Agents In Its SubProxy Account Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1 keeps all tokens of other Agents it holds in its SubProxy account.
Launch Agent 1 Deducts Rebate From Ecosystem Upkeep Fees Launch Agent 1 Core When paying Ecosystem Upkeep fees, Launch Agent 1 deducts the rebate from the fees it pays.
Operational GovOps Reviews Rebate Launch Agent 1 Core Operational GovOps reviews Launch Agent 1's calculation of the rebate before executing a return of surplus to token holders. In the event of any issues, Operational GovOps cannot execute the distribution. If Operational GovOps does not execute the distribution, Operational GovOps must post an explanation on the Sky Forum under the "Launch Agent 1" tag and work with Launch Agent 1 to resolve the disagreement. If Operational GovOps and Launch Agent 1 cannot resolve the disagreement, it must be escalated to Core GovOps.
Non-Routine Protocol Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define the protocol for non-routine ongoing management of the Single Instance of this Upkeep Rebate Primitive.
Emergency Protocol Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define the protocol for handling emergency situations in the ongoing management of the Single Instance of this Upkeep Rebate Primitive.
Data Repository Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein contain data relevant to the Single Instance of the Upkeep Rebate Primitive.

Completed Instances Launch Agent 1 Core The Instances of the Core Governance Reward Primitive with Completed Status are stored herein.
In Progress Invocations Launch Agent 1 Core The in progress Invocations of the Core Governance Reward Primitive are contained herein. Once an Invocation is successfully completed, its subtree will be moved to Active Instances.
Omni Documents Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define Launch Agent 1's strategic intent and operational processes relating to infrastructure inherited from Sky Core, activities unrelated to Sky Primitives, or activities spanning multiple Sky Primitives.
Governance Information Unrelated To Root Edit Primitive Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein specify Launch Agent 1 governance information that is unrelated to the use of the Root Edit Primitive. The governance process for updating the Launch Agent 1 Artifact is specified in the Root Edit Primitive above at Root Edit Primitive.
Sky Forum Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1 uses the Sky Forum for governance-related discussion. Posts should use the "Launch Agent 1" tag.
Sky Ecosystem Emergency Response Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein specify Launch Agent 1's emergency response protocol in situations that impact the entire Sky Ecosystem. This protocol will be specified in a future iteration of the Launch Agent 1 Artifact.
Agent-Specific Emergency Response Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein specify Launch Agent 1's emergency response protocol in situations solely impacting Launch Agent 1 versus the broader Sky Ecosystem. This protocol will be specified in a future iteration of the Launch Agent 1 Artifact.
Strategic Intent Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1's initial priority is to deploy a RWA Allocation Conduit, following which it will deploy crypto-native Conduits for Morpho and Curve.
RWA Conduit Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1 will begin with onboarding winners of the Grand Prix (https://forum.sky.money/t/announcement-spark-tokenization-grand-prix-request-for-proposal/24631) and will expand to additional partners shortly thereafter.
Crypto-Native Conduits Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1 will deploy Allocation Conduits for Morpho and Curve to capture high-yield, low-risk DeFi opportunities.
Morpho Allocation Conduit Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1 will allocate capital to low risk collateral to take advantage of opportunities for high rates in these markets.
Curve Allocation Conduit Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1 will partner with emerging stablecoins to deploy liquidity against fiat-backed stablecoins.
Exploratory Allocation Opportunities Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1 will consider allocations to basis trades, pendle PTs, and other delta-neutral crypto primitives.
Projected Operational Roadmap Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1's phased plan to execute its strategy includes:1) Deploy infrastructure to enable initial allocation conduits;2) Establish manual reallocation processes; and 3) Develop quantitative reallocation parameters and conditions to optimize and decentralize conduit management over time.
Management Of Infrastructure Inherited From Sky Core Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein specify Launch Agent 1's strategy and operational processes for managing infrastructure inherited from Sky Core.
Andromeda Launch Agent 1 Core Control of the Andromeda RWA Arranged Structure is currently being transitioned to Launch Agent 1. Andromeda is the RWA Arranged Structure inherited from Sky Core that allocates capital into safe, short-term treasury strategies of less than one (1) year duration.
Parameters Launch Agent 1 Core The parameters of Andromeda are defined in A.3.4 - Andromeda.
Operational Process Definition Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein define the process for the ongoing management of Andromeda. Future iterations of the Artifact will specify operational processes owned by Launch Agent 1.
Data Repository Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein contain data relevant to Andromeda.
Lite Peg Stability Module Launch Agent 1 Core Control of the Lite PSM is currently being transitioned to Launch Agent 1.
Parameters Launch Agent 1 Core The parameters of the Lite PSM are defined in the Sky Core Atlas.
Operational Process Definition Launch Agent 1 Core The transfer of ongoing management of the Lite PSM is specified in Ecosystem Accord 2, see A.2.10 - Ecosystem Accord 2: Launch Agent 1 And Spark - Star Program.
Parameter Modification Launch Agent 1 Core Sky Core Facilitators currently own the process for modifying the parameters of the Lite PSM, which process is defined in the Sky Core Atlas. This process is currently being transitioned over to Launch Agent 1.
Data Repository Launch Agent 1 Core The documents herein contain data relevant to the Lite PSM.
Ecosystem Accords Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1 has formally agreed to the Ecosystem Accords herein.
Ecosystem Accord 1 Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1 engaged in terms of agreement with the Spark Agent in Ecosystem Accord 1, located in located in A.2.10 - Ecosystem Accord 1: Launch Agent 1 And Spark Agent.
Ecosystem Accord 2 Launch Agent 1 Core Launch Agent 1 engaged in terms of agreement with Sky, Moonbow and the Spark Agent in Ecosystem Accord 2, located in A.2.10 - Ecosystem Accord 2: Launch Agent 1 And Spark - Star Program.
Launch Agent 2 Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein specify all of the logic for Launch Agent 2, including Launch Agent 2's strategy and how it uses the Sky Primitives to operationalize this strategy.
Introduction Launch Agent 2 Core Launch Agent 2 is an Agent dedicated to expanding access to USDS, sUSDS, and other Sky benefits with an initial focus on the Solana ecosystem. Launch Agent 2 leverages strategic incentives and partnerships to foster adoption, deliver the Sky Savings Rate, and bring USDS liquidity to new markets. Launch Agent 2 also identifies and executes allocation opportunities to generate excess returns on assets in Sky's collateral portfolio. Launch Agent 2 plans to develop a user-facing DeFi hub as well as other products that align naturally with Launch Agent 2's existing capabilities, including borrowing and lending solutions.

Parameters Launch Agent 2 Core The parameters of the Root Edit Primitive are fully specified by the Operational Process Definition in Operational Process Definition.
Operational Process Definition Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein define the process for using the Root Edit Primitive to update the Launch Agent 2 Agent Artifact. Information on Launch Agent 2 governance that is unrelated to the use of the Root Edit Primitive is located at Governance Information Unrelated To Root Edit Primitive.
Routine Protocol Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein define the process for using the Root Edit Primitive to update the Launch Agent 2 Agent Artifact in routine or normal conditions (i.e., non-emergency situations).
Root Edit Proposal Submission Launch Agent 2 Core The Root Edit process begins with an AGENT2 token holder submitting a proposal through the Powerhouse system containing a draft Artifact Edit Proposal. An AGENT2 token holder must hold at least 1% of the circulating token supply to submit a proposal. The proposal must also be posted on the Sky Forum under the "Launch Agent 2" tag.
Root Edit Proposal Submission Requirements Exception Launch Agent 2 Core For proposals that solely entail a buyback or a grant of AGENT2 tokens, the requirement that AGENT2 token holders must hold at least 1% of the circulating token supply to submit a proposal is waived. However, all other procedural requirements within the Root Edit process continue to apply.
Root Edit Expert Advisor Review Launch Agent 2 Core A future iteration of the Launch Agent 2 Artifact will specify guidelines for obtaining specialized review of proposals requiring advanced technical or financial analysis.
Root Edit Proposal Review By Operational Facilitator Launch Agent 2 Core Within seven (7) days of the proposal being submitted, the Operational Facilitator must review the Root Edit Proposal for alignment. If the proposal is aligned, the Operational Facilitator must respond to the Forum post to announce their finding. In this Forum post, the Operational Facilitator must also confirm that the proposal is feasible for Operational GovOps to operationalize. If the proposal is misaligned, the Operational Facilitator must respond to the Forum post to announce their finding and provide the reasoning for it.
Root Edit Token Holder Vote Launch Agent 2 Core Where their review of the proposal results in a finding of alignment with the Sky Core Atlas and Launch Agent 2 Artifact, the Operational Facilitator next triggers a Snapshot poll to allow token holders to vote on the proposal. The poll is open for three (3) days. A poll must have at least 10% of the circulating token supply participating and must have 50% of votes in favor to be approved.
Root Edit Artifact Update Launch Agent 2 Core At the conclusion of the poll, if the proposal is approved, the Operational Facilitator submits the edit to Powerhouse to formally update the Agent Artifact. Regardless of the outcome, the Operational Facilitator updates the Powerhouse System to include the result of the vote, including any pertinent documents.
Artifact Edit Restrictions Launch Agent 2 Core The Launch Agent 2 Artifact cannot be edited in any way that violates the Sky Core Atlas or its specifications of the Sky Primitives, or in any way that is otherwise misaligned. The Operational Facilitator must enforce this rule through their review of Artifact Edit Proposals.
Non-Routine Protocol Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein define the process for using the Root Edit Primitive to update the Launch Agent 2 Agent Artifact in non-routine conditions.
Emergency Protocol Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein define the process for using the Root Edit Primitive to update the Launch Agent 2 Agent Artifact in urgent or emergency situations.
Root Edit Voting Process in Urgent and Emergency Situations Launch Agent 2 Core In an Urgent or Emergency Situation, as defined by the Sky Core Atlas in A.1.8 - Emergency Voting System - Definition Of Emergency Situations, the Operational Facilitator may allow a Root Edit to occur more quickly than the timeline specified above. Where feasible, the Operational Facilitator should announce the decision to deploy the emergency Root Edit protocol and provide their reasoning via a public Sky Forum post (under the "Launch Agent 2" tag), unless doing so would endanger Launch Agent 2 or its users.
Data Repository Launch Agent 2 Core The documents herein contain data relevant to the Single Instance of the Root Edit Primitive.

Artifact Edit Proposal Launch Agent 2 Core The materials associated with preparing the Artifact Edit Proposal during the Invocation of this Instance are contained herein.
Completed Instances Launch Agent 2 Core The Instances of the Root Edit Primitive with Completed Status are contained herein.
In Progress Invocations Launch Agent 2 Core Because the Root Edit Primitive is deployed only once, no further Instances of the Primitive can be Invoked.
